comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: You won't believe this - I didn't at first ... I must have a photographic memory and thought this photo looked vaguely familiar. It is the SE corner of Fitzroy Street and Alfred Street in Milsons Point, North Sydney. There is a Phillips Collection photo of the same-ish view (originally thought to be Darling St, Balmain - hence the odd comments). Shop names have changed, and a couple of buildings rebuilt, but still recognisable. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/3054172419/] Google Street View - unrecognisable! - g.co/maps/paxk4

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: John E. Potts (b. 24/6/1832 - d. 25/12/1913) operated two boot shops by 1888, in Blues Point Rd, McMahons Point (then known as Victoria) and here in Alfred Street, Milsons Point (then known as St. Leonards East). - see Sands 1888. Which is quite a feat, considering he moved to Sydney from the Hawskebury with his wife and 7 young children in 1872 following insolvency - www.easystreetretreat.com.au/australianroyalty/individual...
